values.help: Flush on off thermostat module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.
values.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF

items.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

values.help:
When I2 is pressed set point will be set according to the value of this parameter.
                Default value 32767.
                32767 - input I2 does not influence on the set point
                From 0 to 990 - set point from 0.0 C to 99.0 C
                From 1001 to 1150 - set point from -0.1 C to -15.0 C
values.label: Set point set by I2

values.help:
When I3 is pressed set point will be set according to the value of this parameter.
                Default value 32767.
                32767 - input I2 does not influence on the set point
                From 0 to 990 - set point from 0.0 C to 99.0 C
                From 1001 to 1150 - set point from -0.1 C to -15.0 C
values.label: Set point set by I3

values.help: If Disabled, after a power failure, module return to OFF position.
values.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

values.help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 3
values.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change

values.help:
Set value means time interval (0 - 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled.
                1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds.
                Reporting enabled.
                Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.
                Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)
values.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval

values.help:
This parameter defines temperature min difference between real measured temperature and set-point temperature to turn heating on.
                The parameter can be set from 0 to 255 where 0 to 128 means from 0.0 C to 12.8 C and from 129 to 255 means from - 0.0 C to -12.8 C.
                Default value 132 (-0.5 C)
values.label: Hysteresis On

values.help:
This parameter defines temperature min difference between real measured temperature and set-point temperature to turn heating off.
                The parameter can be set from 0 to 255 where 0 to 128 means from 0.0 C to 12.8 C and from 129 to 255 means from - 0.0 C to -12.8 C.
                Default value 5 (+0.5 C)
values.label: Hysteresis Off

values.help:
Set value means at which temperature the device will be turned on even if the thermostat was manually set to off.
                0 - 127 = 0.0C - 12.7 C.
                128 - 254 = -0.1C - 12.6 C.
                255 - Antifreeze functionality disabled.
                Default value 50 (5.0 C).
values.label: Antifreeze

values.help:
Default value 50 (Minimum Temperature alarm is 5.0C)
                1 - 1000 = 0.1C - 100.0C, step is 0.1C.
                Too low temperature limit is set by entered value. In case is set value out of this range, module is changing set value automatically to default value.
values.label: Too low temperature limit

values.help:
Default value 700 (Minimum Temperature alarm is 70.0C)
                1 - 1000 = 0.1C - 100.0C, step is 0.1C.
                Too high temperature limit is set by entered value. In case is set value out of this range, module is changing automatically set value to default value.
values.label: Too high temperature limit

values.help:
Set value means the type of the device that is connected to the relay output. The device type can be normally open (NO) or normally close (NC).
                Available config. parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):
                default value 0
                0 - When system is turned off the output is 0 V.
                1 - When system is turned off the output is 230 V.
values.label: Switch selection

values.help:
Enabling I1 means that Endpoint (I1) will be present on UI.
                Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.
                Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.
                NOTE 1: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) and then re include the module!
                NOTE 2: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are send for Home Security.
values.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I1 or select notification type and event

values.help:
Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI.
                Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.
                Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.
                NOTE 1: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) and then re include the module!
                NOTE 2: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are send for Home Security.
values.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select notification type and event

values.help:
Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI.
                Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.
                Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.
                NOTE 1: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) and then re include the module!
                NOTE 2: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are send for Home Security.
values.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select notification type and event

values.help:
Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.
                From 1 to 100 = value from 0.1C to 10.0C is added to actual measured temperature.
                From 1001 to 1100 = value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.
                Default value 32536. 32536  offset is 0.0C.
values.label: Temperature sensor offset settings

values.help:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.
                0 = reporting disabled.
                1 to 127 = 0,1C to 12,7C, step is 0,1C.
                Default value is 5 = 0,5C
values.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
